children.author: somewhereovertherainbro
speedywrx
somewhereovertherainbro
speedywrx
somewhereovertherainbro
children.comment: My Canon 50mm f/1.4 has developed a pretty bad front focus issue, gotta use liveview and focus peaking, sucks to be me.
True, if I'm working wide open at 1.4 and very close to my subject for min DOF I'm on a tripod and I'll change the focus pt.
That works at high fstop, forget about that at f/1.4. One of the cool things about only having 9 points is how quick it is to change
You can do that too. For me it's faster to keep a single center pt, focus & recompose rather than moving the D-pad on the back to change pts
Or use something other then a central AF point, I have 9 and that's very little compared to real cameras, still more than enough.

children.author: WackTheHorld
speedywrx
speedywrx
children.comment: So you don't have to change modes (From AF-C to AF-S) in different situations.  Just leave it AF-C and your thumb controls it all.
If you have focus on a diff button (right thumb on back) with AF-C, you can press/hold to keep it cont. or press/release to lock the focus.
I've tried moving af to a different button, and I don't like it at all.

data.comment: Decouple your focus from your shutter release button. Map focus to a button on the back.  Use a single focus point, focus, recompose, shoot.
